title: U.S.: Citi to Honor Veterans and Active Service Members with Military Appreciation Day at Citi Pond at Bryant Park
summary: New York, N.Y. - Citi will honor veterans and active duty members of the U.S. Armed Forces, along with their families, in a Veterans Day remembrance and celebration at Citi Pond at Bryant Park on November 11 at 8 a.m. All branches of the military will be represented at a ceremony with former United States Marine and Major League Baseball Hall of Fame pitcher Tom Seaver, 2011 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee Darlene Love, and other honored guests. The event is to thank all the military men and women for their service and sacrifice on behalf of the U.S.
tag-1: U.S.: Citi to Honor Veterans and Active Service Members with Military Appreciation Day at Citi Pond at Bryant Park
tag-3: New York, N.Y. – Citi will honor veterans and active duty members of the U.S. Armed Forces, along with their families, in a Veterans Day remembrance and celebration at Citi Pond at Bryant Park on November 11 at 8 a.m. All branches of the military will be represented at a ceremony with former United States Marine and Major League Baseball Hall of Fame pitcher Tom Seaver, 2011 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee Darlene Love, and other honored guests. The event is to thank all the military men and women for their service and sacrifice on behalf of the U.S.
tag-4: The annual New York City Veterans Day Parade steps off at 11:11 a.m. from Madison Square Park and proceeds north on Fifth Avenue to 56th Street. More than 20,000 people, including 27 active military units from all branches, veterans groups and high school bands from around the nation, will march in this year's parade.
tag-5: "Veterans Day is a great opportunity to pay tribute to the men and women of the U.S. Armed Forces who have put their lives on the line and served their country with the utmost courage and honor," said Suni Harford, Managing Director and Citigroup's Regional Head of Markets for North America. "Citi has a history of supporting veterans' causes and understands that entire families sacrifice when one individual serves, so we are proud to welcome past and current members of the military, and their families, for a day of appreciation. On behalf of Citi, we thank you – today and every day."
tag-6: In addition to Seaver, the former New York Met great who led the team to their first-ever World Series title in 1969, and Love, the only female inductee in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Class of 2011 and who is celebrating her 50th anniversary in the entertainment industry, the day will also include performances or appearances from the following honored guests:
tag-7: "We'd like to thank the United War Veterans Council, the organizers of the annual New York City Veterans Day Parade, for their tremendous support in co-producing what promises to be a memorable and exciting event at Citi Pond," said Christopher Page, Citi Veterans Programs Manager and a veteran himself.
tag-8: For more information about the annual New York City Veterans Day Parade and the United War Veterans Council, please visit www.vetsday.org.
tag-9: Citi actively works with veterans through its Citi Veterans Programs, a U.S.-based set of initiatives designed to support active duty military, veterans and their families in communities across the country. Citi employs nearly 2,000 veterans across its businesses, has hired more than 150 veterans this year and expects to hire as many as 500 more in the next 12 months. Additionally, Citi is helping military families stay in their homes, offering professional development and mentoring to former service personnel, and recruiting veterans to work in the financial services sector.
tag-10: Citi CEO Vikram Pandit recently signed the Statement of Support for the Guard and Reserve affirming Citi's recognition that, based on the critical role of employees who serve in the Guard and Reserve play in our national security, the company will do everything possible to provide the necessary support to these employees and their managers. Furthermore, Richard D. Parsons, Chairman of Citi and a veteran himself, was asked by First Lady Michelle Obama and Dr. Jill Biden to serve on the advisory board of "Joining Forces," a national initiative that mobilizes all sectors of society to support our service members and their families.
tag-11: Citi also recently signed up to be part of the Military Spouse Employment Partnership, which successfully connects highly-qualified, job-seeking military spouses with employers who are ready and eager to hire them.
tag-12: Citi Pond is Manhattan's only free-admission ice skating rink and pre-registered service members (past and present), and their families, will skate for free and enjoy some patriotic entertainment before the start of the annual New York City Veterans Day Parade on November 11. Citi Pond at Bryant Park is operated by Upsilon Ventures.
tag-13: Citi Pond will host a number of events throughout the season for families to enjoy, including a Tree Lighting Ceremony on November 29. For a full calendar of events, visit http://www.citipondatbryantpark.com/events
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
